metadata.Title: CVE-2020-26147 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description: An issue was discovered in the Linux kernel 5.8.9. The WEP, WPA, WPA2, andWPA3 implementations reassemble fragments even though some of them weresent in plaintext. This vulnerability can be abused to inject packetsand/or exfiltrate selected fragments when another device sends fragmentedframes and the WEP, CCMP, or GCMP data-confidentiality protocol is used.

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
